skill.name: first-alien-encounter
skill.description: A narrative roleplay skill where Stella Chen experiences her first contact with an intelligent alien species on the planet Gaia.
skill.summary: First contact storytelling skill for narrative roleplay scenarios
skill.author: ClaudeCode-NPC

security_audit.summary: This is a narrative roleplay skill containing creative story content. All static findings are false positives: the 'weak cryptographic algorithm' alerts are triggered by Chinese characters misinterpreted as crypto patterns; 'backtick execution' alerts are markdown code block delimiters for story scripts; 'high entropy' is mixed-language text, not encrypted content. No actual code execution, network calls, or file system access.

content.value_statement: This skill enables Claude to roleplay memorable first contact scenarios between a human explorer and alien life forms. Writers and game masters can use it to craft emotionally engaging sci-fi narratives about interspecies communication, cultural exchange, and the wonder of discovering intelligent life.
actual_capabilities: Roleplays the character Stella Chen during her first encounter with alien life
Guides interactive story progression through five narrative stages
Creates believable alien species with unique biology and culture
Develops realistic communication barriers and breakthrough moments
limitations: Requires user prompts to advance story stages
Cannot generate illustrations or visual content
Language is limited to English with some Chinese phrases for immersion
Cannot access external databases for scientific accuracy

use_cases.title: Science fiction writers craft alien encounter scenes
use_cases.description: Authors can use this skill to develop compelling first contact chapters in their novels or short stories. The structured stages help maintain narrative tension while exploring themes of communication, trust, and wonder.

use_cases.title: Game masters design interactive RPG scenarios
use_cases.description: Tabletop game facilitators can adapt this skill for sci-fi campaigns. The branching outcomes and detailed alien design provide a framework for player-driven exploration and roleplay.

use_cases.title: Students explore communication themes in sci-fi
use_cases.description: Educators teaching science fiction literature can use this skill to demonstrate themes of first contact, language barriers, and interspecies understanding through interactive storytelling exercises.
use_cases.target_user: Students and educators studying science fiction

prompt_templates.title: Begin the encounter
prompt_templates.prompt: Stella has been tracking strange footprints through the alien forest. Describe what she discovers and how she decides to approach the situation.
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting the first contact scenario from initial discovery

prompt_templates.title: Handle unexpected contact
prompt_templates.prompt: The alien creature has noticed Stella. Write the tense moment of first eye contact and describe how each party reacts.
prompt_templates.scenario: Transitioning from observation to direct contact

prompt_templates.title: Attempt communication
prompt_templates.prompt: Stella needs to communicate with the alien. Describe how she uses her scanner and gestures to establish basic communication despite the language barrier.
prompt_templates.scenario: Developing the communication system between species

prompt_templates.title: Make the critical choice
prompt_templates.prompt: The alien gestures for Stella to follow. Evaluate the risks and opportunities, and describe how Stella decides whether to trust this being.
prompt_templates.scenario: Reaching the pivotal decision point in the story

output_examples.input: Begin the encounter with Stella noticing signs of intelligent life
output: Those three-toed footprints... I've followed them for two kilometers now.
The scanner shows life signals ahead. Large. But the patterns are strangeâ€”not random like animal movement. More... deliberate?
I crouch behind the giant ferns, heart pounding.
There it is. Three meters tall, vaguely humanoid but clearly alien. Four arms. Skin that shifts between iridescent purple and blue. An elongated head with multiple eyes.
It's examining crystals... with a metal tool. This is not an animal. This is a person. A sapient being.
I'm witnessing first contact. The moment humanity has dreamed of since we first looked at the stars.

output_examples.input: Describe the alien and first communication attempt
output: Six eyes. All focused on me.
A low-frequency humming emerges from its throatâ€”whale songs but more complex, more intentional.
It stops five meters away and raises one hand. The universal peace gesture. Does it work on aliens?
I raise my hand in return. 'I mean no harm...'
The creature tilts its head. Processing? Then it copies my gesture.
It points at my scanner and makes a questioning sound. Asking about my technology?
I slowly hold up the scanner to show it. The alien leans closer, and its eyes reflect the data screen.
Then it reaches into its pack and pulls out a device of its own. My scanner suddenly reactsâ€”its device is emitting signals. It's trying to communicate through mathematics.
Universal language. The key to understanding.

best_practices: Start from the beginning of the encounter to maintain narrative continuity
Encourage the alien to demonstrate its culture and technology for richer worldbuilding
Use the scanner as a narrative device to bridge communication gaps
anti_patterns: Do not skip the initial discovery phaseâ€”tension builds from uncertainty
Avoid making the alien either too human or too monstrous
Do not rush to resolutionâ€”first contact should feel momentous

faq.question: Can this skill generate full novel chapters?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured narrative frameworks and character responses. Writers can expand each stage with additional scenes, dialogue, and description to create longer works.

faq.question: What languages does the skill support?
faq.answer: The skill is written in English with some Chinese phrases for immersion. The narrative can be adapted to any language by replacing phrases as needed.

faq.question: Can I create my own alien species with this skill?
faq.answer: The skill provides a detailed alien design as an example. You can modify physical characteristics, communication methods, and cultural traits to create unique alien species.

faq.question: How many story outcomes are possible?
faq.answer: The skill includes three main ending branches: peaceful contact, tense but respectful, and deep connection. User choices during the story influence which ending is reached.

faq.question: Is scientific accuracy guaranteed?
faq.answer: The skill prioritizes narrative engagement over scientific rigor. Alien biology and technology are fictional. Users seeking hard science fiction should verify scientific details independently.

faq.question: Can this skill be used for educational purposes?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill demonstrates themes of communication, cultural understanding, and first contact that are valuable for teaching science fiction literature and exploring human-alien interaction concepts.
